tuv.seg: In financial markets, a share is a unit of account for various financial instruments including stocks, mutual funds, limited partnerships.
在金融市场上，份额是会计单位各种各样的金融证券的包括股票，共同基金，有限合伙。
In British English, use of the word shares in the plural to refer to stock is so widespread that it almost replaces the word stock itself.
在英国英语，对在复数的词份额的用途提到股票很普遍它几乎替换词股票。
In American English, the plural stocks is often used instead of shares, in other words to refer to the stock (or perhaps originally stock certificates) of even just one company.
在美国英语，复数股票是常用的而不是份额，换句话说提到股票(或许或最初股票簿)甚而一家公司。
The traditional insistence that the plural stocks be used only when referring to stock of more than one company is not common nowadays.
复数股票使用，只有当提到股票时的传统坚持超过一家公司现今不是共同的。
The income received from shares is called a dividend, and someone owning shares is called a shareholder.
从份额领取的报酬称股息，并且拥有份额的某人称股东。

A share is one of a finite number of equal portions in the capital of a company, entitling the owner to a proportion of distributed, non-reinvested profits known as dividends, and to a portion of the value of the company in case of liquidation.
份额是一个相等的部分的一个有限数字在公司的首都的，给权所有者对叫作股息的分布的，非被再投资的赢利的比例和对公司的价值的部分在清盘的情况下。
Shares can be voting or non-voting, meaning they either do or do not carry the right to vote on the board of directors and corporate policy.
份额可以是投票或弃权的，意味他们做或不运载权利对理事和公司政策投票。
Whether this right exists often affects the value of the share.
这权利是否经常存在影响份额的价值。
Voting and non-voting shares are also known as Class A and B shares respectively.
亦称投票和弃权部份分别为类A和B份额。
